channel.desc: Whether its sports, esports, UCI, Ironman, F1, WRC, TV, music, festivals, films or videos, Red Bull TV has it all!

programme.title: Hubertusjagd SE3
programme.desc: Hubertus von Hohenlohe continues his tour of exciting locations around the globe. This time he travels to Athens, Greece, to check out famous sandals, archaeology, water skiing and more.
programme.series-desc: Hubertus von Hohenlohe travels to Athens to check out famous sandals, archaeology, water skiing and more.

programme.title: +27: Social Innovators of South Africa
programme.desc: Cape Town musical icon DJ Ready D, a Red Bull Amaphiko Academy mentor, is the founder of the Great Cape Ambassadors Program (G-CAP), a grassroots organisation that uses hip-hop to inspire at-risk youth in his childhood neighbourhood, Mitchells Plain.
programme.series-desc: Cape Town musical icon DJ Ready D launches a grassroots organisation to inspire youth through hip-hop.

programme.title: Lindsey Vonn: The Climb
programme.desc: After two devastating injuries, Lindsey Vonn is faced with the biggest challenge of her life. Can she recover and reclaim her place at the top of the competitive ski world? This film chronicles her journey and personal story of overcoming adversity.
programme.series-desc: An inside look at Lindsey Vonn's two-year journey to return from injury to world-class competitive skiing.

programme.title: Behind the Lines: Deeper
programme.desc: What motivates someone to risk everything for a few seconds of paradise? Big wave surfer Andrew Cotton, along with some leading psychologists, break down the reasons people are drawn to activities where one mistake can mean serious injury or death.
programme.series-desc: Surfer Andrew Cotton thinks death should be stared in the face from time to time, and psychologists agree.

programme.title: Behind the Lines: Deeper
programme.desc: To surf at the level Andrew Cotton does, he has to go far beyond his natural talent. Mental and physical training gives Andrew the confidence to surf the enormous slabs that he chases. This is his regimen for facing the giants.
programme.series-desc: To surf the waves Andrew Cotton does, one has to be prepared both mentally and physically. This is what it takes.

programme.title: Behind the Lines: Deeper
programme.desc: When chasing huge waves, most of the variables are beyond the surfer's control. Andrew Cotton talks about controlling what he can with his equipment and the safety procedures he uses when he surfs.
programme.series-desc: Andrew Cotton talks about the most controllable variable when surfing big waves: the equipment.

programme.title: Breaking the Ice
programme.desc: Red Bull München's captain, Michael Wolf, intends to retire after the 2019 season to return to his original hometown Füssen, where he's taking over his dad's shoe store. Wolf shares how it feels to hang up the skates to sell shoes.
programme.series-desc: Michael Wolf shares how it feels to hang up the skates to sell shoes after returning to his hometown.

programme.title: Breaking the Ice
programme.desc: See the life, training and problems of young and upcoming hockey goalie Kevin Reich and get to know his experienced goalie colleague and mentor Danny aus den Birken.
programme.series-desc: See the life, training and problems of young and upcoming hockey goalie Kevin Reich.

programme.title: Away from Keyboard
programme.sub-title: Mang0 and Meagan face off with sharks
programme.desc: Red Bull wakeboarder Meagan Ethell takes Cloud9's Mang0 wakeboarding and swimming with sharks. Both athletes learn the importance of getting out of their heads to be able to be their best in competition.
programme.series-desc: Cloud9's Mang0 and Red Bull's wakeboarder Meagan Ethell spend a day wakeboarding and swimming with sharks.

programme.title: Away from Keyboard
programme.sub-title: Milktea and Sasha climb to new heights
programme.desc: Lilian ‘Milktea’ Chen, Smash Sisters co-founder, throws herself at the problem when playing Smash – will that same method work for her when rock climbing? Rock climber Sasha DiGiulian takes Milktea for a climb to learn about problem solving.
programme.series-desc: Rock climber Sasha Digiulian takes Smash Brothers pro Milktea for a climb to learn about problem solving.

programme.title: Away from Keyboard
programme.sub-title: Tempo Storm takes a leap of faith
programme.desc: Like cliff diving, the game Hearthstone is all about calculating risk. Watch as Red Bull cliff diver David Colturi teaches Hearthstone’s Tempo Storm team members Frodan and Reynad to face their nerves and perform a cliff dive.
programme.series-desc: Red Bull cliff diver David Colturi teaches Hearthstone team members to cliff dive.

programme.title: Builder
programme.sub-title: The art and science of trail building
programme.desc: Director Scott Secco captures the craft of trail building through the eyes of some of MTB's best riders and most respected builders. More than just shovelling dirt, these artisans sculpt well-flowing trails by detecting key nuances in the earth.
programme.series-desc: Explore the craft of trail building through the eyes of some of MTB's best riders and most respected builders.

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Team Liquid's training includes not only team building and practice sessions, they're also working out in the gym with the high performance team. But high expectations and a tech glitch yield rising tensions when it's time to qualify for TI4.
programme.series-desc: Team Liquid attempts to qualify for TI4 while training with the high performance team, but tensions rise.

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Jimmy reflects on TI4 and critiques his performance there. He also reflects on how the intensity of championship play in Seattle brought out Liquid's teamwork dysfunctions. In the aftermath of their poor results, the team opts to part ways.
programme.series-desc: Jimmy reflects back on his and Liquid's peformance at TI4 and the team's split in the disappointing aftermath.

programme.title: Against the Odds
programme.sub-title: The story of a new team coming together
programme.desc: In 2018, OG were at rock-bottom, hit by painful departures and scrapping in qualifiers for Dota 2's TI8. Against the Odds is the fairytale of this broken team's shot at Gaming’s biggest prize.
programme.series-desc: This is the story of Team OG’s incredible journey from underdogs to contenders for gaming’s biggest prize.

programme.title: Follow the Steps
programme.desc: After the premiere of the new show in Austria, the Flying Steps hit the high seas to perform on a cruise ship. Robozee has his debut as the lead choreographer for a futuristic holographic show and gives a tour of his hometown of Kassel, Germany.
programme.series-desc: After the premiere of the new show in Austria, the Flying Steps hit the high seas to perform on a cruise ship.

programme.title: Distance Between Dreams
programme.desc: A crew of top surfers, headed by Ian Walsh, attempt to paddle in on one of the world’s biggest waves: Jaws. Already formidable, the Hawaiian break's been sent to new heights by weather phenomenon El Niño.
programme.series-desc: During a historically big winter, iconic surfer Ian Walsh is out to redefine the ceiling on paddle surfing.

programme.title: Campfire Stories
programme.sub-title: Carson Storch’s hairy tale of grizzly bears
programme.desc: Without radio contact or bear repellent, a group of professional mountain bikers had a too-close-for-comfort encounter with a group of grizzly bears deep in the Yukon.
programme.series-desc: Deep in the Yukon, a crew of mountain bikers are confronted by a family of grizzly bears.

programme.title: Campfire Stories
programme.desc: Wingsuit BASE jumper Jeff Provenzano recounts the time a less-than-perfect landing saw him end up dangling from a tree in a Swiss mountain forest. He hung there, 60ft off the ground, for three hours until a helicopter rescue team plucked him out.
programme.series-desc: Wingsuit BASE jumper Jeff Provenzano recalls the time he ended up landing 60ft off the ground in a tree.

programme.title: Perspective
programme.desc: Reflecting on how their different backgrounds influence their skating styles, four world class skaters join forces in Arizona to explore new territory and tricks.
programme.series-desc: Four skaters from different backgrounds and styles convene in Arizona to explore new territory and tricks.

programme.title: Red Bull Signature Series
programme.desc: The world's first-ever off-road truck race on snow features eight 900bhp Pro 4s driven by the best in the world, including Ricky Johnson and Bryce Menzies, who navigate the slippery slopes in front of 10,000 fans.
programme.series-desc: The world's first-ever off-road truck race on snow features Pro 4s navigating some slippery slopes.

programme.title: Blood Road
programme.desc: In this award-winning film, Rebecca Rusch cycles 1,930km along the Ho Chi Minh Trail through the jungles of Vietnam. The goal is to reach the site where her father, a US Air Force pilot, was shot down in Laos more than 40 years earlier.
programme.series-desc: Rebecca Rusch rides 1,930km along the infamous Ho Chi Minh Trail through the dense jungles of Vietnam.

programme.title: Route to Red Bull BC One
programme.desc: B-Boy Lil Zoo from Morocco shares his journey to Red Bull BC One that began in 2012 as he worked his way through wins and losses to get where he is today.
programme.series-desc: B-Boy Lil Zoo from Morocco shares his journey to Red Bull BC One that began in 2012.

programme.title: Route to Red Bull BC One
programme.desc: With one month to prepare for Red Bull BC One World Final B-Boy Lil Zoo is focusing on stamina and strength. See how he mentally and physically prepares to battle.
programme.series-desc: With one month to prepare for Red Bull BC One World Final B-Boy Lil Zoo is focusing on stamina and strength.

programme.title: SCREENLAND
programme.desc: When it comes to indie game developers, thinking outside the box is a way of life. For example, these two teams: one working on iPad games for cats, and a husband and wife duo working on a one-of-a-kind game called Butt-Sniffin' Pugs.
programme.series-desc: Meet game developers passionate about their pet projects: an iPad game for cats and Butt-Sniffin' Pugs.

programme.title: SCREENLAND
programme.desc: The internet cartoon Homestar Runner and the kid's television show Knightmare both have huge cult followings that go back decades. Now both are receiving modern-day tributes, a testament to their impact on pop culture.
programme.series-desc: Two cult classics receive modern-day tributes, a testament to their impact and cultural legacy.

programme.title: Cut Your Teeth
programme.sub-title: The highs and lows of rock and roll
programme.desc: This documentary delves into the world of living a life dedicated to rock and roll and alternative culture. Ride with the bands and hear stories from the road. Learn how much commitment it takes to ride the ups and downs of a musician's life.
programme.series-desc: Follow the lives of several bands who are committed to living an alternative, rock and roll lifestyle.

programme.title: A History of...
programme.desc: From a race down a hill covered in fish market ice to a World Cup series that pulls in a quarter of a million spectators annually, this is how the unlikely mashup of a hockey fight and boardercross became the exciting sport of Ice Cross Downhill.
programme.series-desc: This is the story of how the unlikely pairing of hockey and boardercross became a global racing phenomenon.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.desc: Marcel Hirscher looks ahead after another decorated season while Marco Odermatt and Alexis Pinturault do their best to race well at the FIS Alpine Ski World Cup finals in Andorra.
programme.series-desc: After another decorated season, Marcel Hirscher looks ahead to the FIS Alpine Ski World Cup finals in Andorra.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.sub-title: Skiing says so long to Aksel Lund Svindal
programme.desc: After one of the greatest alpine skiing careers, we pay tribute to Aksel Lund Svindal as he bows out of his racing career after the world championship in Sweden, while Dominik Paris and Beat Feuz go to war for the World Cup downhill title.
programme.series-desc: As skiing pays tribute to retiring Aksel Lund Svindal, the men's DH World Cup goes down to the wire.

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Jimmy "DeMoN" Ho and Team Liquid start a month-long stay at Red Bull's eSports Studio in Santa Monica, where they begin training for TI4. During counseling, the team discovers they have communication and trust issues that need to be addressed.
programme.series-desc: Jimmy "DeMoN" Ho and Team Liquid start a month-long stay at Red Bull's eSports Studio in California.

programme.title: Builder
programme.sub-title: The art and science of trail building
programme.desc: Director Scott Secco captures the craft of trail building through the eyes of some of MTB's best riders and most respected builders. More than just shovelling dirt, these artisans sculpt well-flowing trails by detecting key nuances in the earth.
programme.series-desc: Explore the craft of trail building through the eyes of some of MTB's best riders and most respected builders.

programme.sub-title: The story of a new team coming together
programme.desc: In 2018, OG were at rock-bottom, hit by painful departures and scrapping in qualifiers for Dota 2's TI8. Against the Odds is the fairytale of this broken team's shot at Gaming’s biggest prize.
programme.series-desc: This is the story of Team OG’s incredible journey from underdogs to contenders for gaming’s biggest prize.

programme.title: Follow the Steps
programme.desc: After the premiere of the new show in Austria, the Flying Steps hit the high seas to perform on a cruise ship. Robozee has his debut as the lead choreographer for a futuristic holographic show and gives a tour of his hometown of Kassel, Germany.
programme.series-desc: After the premiere of the new show in Austria, the Flying Steps hit the high seas to perform on a cruise ship.

programme.title: Distance Between Dreams
programme.desc: A crew of top surfers, headed by Ian Walsh, attempt to paddle in on one of the world’s biggest waves: Jaws. Already formidable, the Hawaiian break's been sent to new heights by weather phenomenon El Niño.
programme.series-desc: During a historically big winter, iconic surfer Ian Walsh is out to redefine the ceiling on paddle surfing.

programme.title: Campfire Stories
programme.desc: Wingsuit BASE jumper Jeff Provenzano recounts the time a less-than-perfect landing saw him end up dangling from a tree in a Swiss mountain forest. He hung there, 60ft off the ground, for three hours until a helicopter rescue team plucked him out.
programme.series-desc: Wingsuit BASE jumper Jeff Provenzano recalls the time he ended up landing 60ft off the ground in a tree.

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Boot camp begins with EEG testing to identify strengths and growth opportunities. Then it's time for team-building exercises that find Team Liquid paddleboarding as a group and even living together, following the model of successful Korean teams.
programme.series-desc: Boot camp begins with EEG testing and team building as Liquid works on their trust issues.

programme.title: I am the Engine
programme.desc: In India the social media platform and mobile app Robin Hood Army collects food from people who have too much and delivers it for free to people in need.
programme.series-desc: The Robin Hood Army app collects food from people who have too much and delivers it for free to people in need.

programme.title: I am the Engine
programme.desc: A group of rural farmers near an active volcano in Bali created a company that turns bamboo stalks into bicycles in order to benefit the local community.
programme.series-desc: Rural farmers near an active volcano in Bali created a company that turns bamboo stalks into bicycles.

programme.title: Back to the Bowl
programme.desc: The beachside skatepark in Marseille is one of the most famous in the world. Retrace its history with the skateboard legends who've shredded the bowl over the past 25 years to see why it's so iconic.
programme.series-desc: Explore the history of one of the world's most iconic skate spots as told by the riders who made it famous.

programme.title: Beneath the Ice
programme.desc: Canadian ice climber Will Gadd uses his unmatched skills and knowledge to lead a scientific expedition into a previously unexplored territory beneath the Greenland ice sheet.
programme.series-desc: Will Gadd uses his unmatched ice climbing skills and knowledge to lead a scientific expedition into a previously unexplored territory beneath the Greenland ice sheet.

programme.title: Follow the Steps
programme.desc: As the final touches are put on the Flying Illusion show in Austria, Robozee and Bboy Willy share how they became the newest members of the Flying Steps. Amok prepares for an explosive video shoot, and the curtain goes up on opening night.
programme.series-desc: Before the Austrian premiere of Flying Illusion, the newest members of the team tell their stories.

programme.title: Ivy Being Ivy
programme.desc: Ivy Miller heads to beautiful Costa Rica for a photo shoot. Join her on the journey as she checks out the local drinks, catches some waves and meets some cheeky monkeys.
programme.series-desc: Join Ivy Miller in Costa Rica as she checks out the local drinks, catches some waves and meets some monkeys.

programme.title: Ivy Being Ivy
programme.desc: Ivy Miller rocks up in Puerto Escondido, where the crocs are as big as the surf. In between downpours she also finds time to take a boat trip, update her dating profile and extend her comedy tour.
programme.series-desc: Ivy Miller rocks up in Puerto Escondido where the only thing bigger than the local crocs is the surf.

programme.title: Ride with the Swedes
programme.desc: Martin Söderström and Anton Thelander keep the New Zealand fun pumping by riding Queenstown's Dream Track trail. Cam McCaul and Ryan Howard show them the way to the legendary Frew Farm jump course, but a prank war breaks out on the way.
programme.series-desc: Martin Söderström and Anton Thelander visit New Zealand's Dream Track trail and Frew Farm's epic bike jumps.

programme.title: Ride with the Swedes
programme.desc: Freeride mountain bikers Martin Söderström and Anton Thelander go to the Eurobike trade show in Germany to meet with sponsors and fans before heading off to Livigno, Italy for the Nine Knights contest.
programme.series-desc: Martin Söderström and Anton Thelander head to Germany, then Italy for the Nine Knights contest in Livigno.

programme.title: Red Bull Signature Series
programme.desc: In the final event of the 2013 Traxxas season, the top truck drivers in the USA try their hands at racing 900hp short-course battle trucks in Primm, Nevada. At 100mph, the rock-and-mud-strewn course tests the mettle of even the most skilled drivers.
programme.series-desc: Top USA truck drivers race short-course battle trucks at 100mph in the season's final Traxxas event.

programme.title: Rainbow Dive
programme.desc: World champion cliff diver Rhiannan Iffland journeys to the Australian Outback to rediscover her sense of self and love for diving and in the process uncovers a whole lot more than she bargained for.
programme.series-desc: Rhiannan Iffland journeys to the Australian Outback and uncovers more than she expected.

programme.title: After the Raves
programme.desc: DJ Tommie Sunshine explores the symbiosis between EDM and technology in San Francisco, with artists such as DJ Chuckie, Hardkiss and The M Machine seamlessly weaving tech into their work.
programme.series-desc: In San Francisco, EDM blends technology and art for artists like DJ Chuckie, Hardkiss and The M Machine.

programme.title: Fast Life
programme.desc: With the UCI DH MTB World Cup season fast approaching, the top riders in both the men’s and women’s divisions get ready to prove that their off seasons were well spent. The time for talk is over. Riding fast is all that matters now.
programme.series-desc: As the UCI DH MTB World Cup season approaches, the time for talk is over. Riding fast is all that matters now.

programme.title: Fast Life
programme.desc: With the 2017 season kicking off in Lourdes, France, expectations are running high. But in DH mountain biking, the only certainty is that anything can happen. For Loïc Bruni and the rest of the sport's elite, this means taking nothing for granted.
programme.series-desc: In downhill mountain bike racing, the only certainty is that nothing is certain until the last rider's run.

programme.title: Fast Life
programme.desc: Fort William, Scotland, has been hosting DH World Cup events since 2002, and the long track always makes for electrifying racing. Leading up to the race in 2017, it's key to examine the factors that can make (and break) a winning streak.
programme.series-desc: Coming into the race in Fort William, Scotland, it's time to look at what makes (and breaks) winning streaks.

programme.title: Wreck or Get Rekt
programme.sub-title: A battle between video game rivals
programme.desc: Two video game rivals prepare to face off in a riveting head-to-head matchup. This exciting film merges the thrill of watching professional sports with the worldwide phenomenon of video games.
programme.series-desc: A couple of video game rivals get ready to face off in a head-to-head match.

programme.title: Travailen
programme.desc: At midnight on Monday, March 24, 2014, trailblazers Ryan Sandes and Ryno Griesel embarked on the ultimate Drakensberg adventure – the Drakensberg Grand Traverse – in an attempt to break the current record of 60h 29m.
programme.series-desc: Trailblazers Ryan Sandes and Ryno Griesel embarked on the ultimate Drakensberg adventure.

programme.title: Mates in Alaska
programme.desc: New Zealand's backcountry megastar Jake Koia is joined by Roland Morely-Brown on a journey to Haines, Alaska in search of perfect backcountry to ride. Luck is on their side, as they find perfect riding conditions on their first day out.
programme.series-desc: New Zealand snowboarders Jake Koia and Roland Morely-Brown take a dream trip to Haines, Alaska to snowboard.

programme.title: Mates in Alaska
programme.desc: Snowboarders Jake Koia and Roland Morley-Brown gear up for another epic bluebird day in Alaska's backcountry. After shredding some huge, picturesque lines, they decide the best way to follow that up is to shoot some high-powered guns with the locals.
programme.series-desc: Jake and Roland are blessed with a perfect day for snowboarding... and shooting guns with locals.

programme.title: McCaul Meets
programme.desc: Cam McCaul travels to Poland to meet up with Szymon Godziek and his family at home. Cam gets a guided tour around Szymon’s specially-designed, obstacle-laden MTB practice yard, and Szymon shares some thoughts about his sport and home life.
programme.series-desc: Cam McCaul meets up with Szymon Godziek at home in Poland and gets to ride at Szymon’s MTB practice yard.

programme.title: Ultimate Gasly
programme.desc: Get to know the people who surround Formula One driver Pierre Gasly, icluding his engineer and coach who help him through every race. Respect and trust are key in these relationships in order for them to be able to push Gasly to be the fastest.
programme.series-desc: Get to know the people who surround Formula One driver and GP2 champion Pierre Gasly.

programme.title: Ultimate Gasly
programme.desc: Formula One is a sport that requires well-rounded physical fitness from its pilots. Get a glimpse at the training routine Pierre Gasly's coach, Pyry, has him keeping to focus on retaining his energy.
programme.series-desc: Get a glimpse at the training routine Pierre Gasly's coach, Pyry, has him keeping.

programme.title: Ultimate Gasly
programme.desc: Take a look at the details that go into Pierre Gasly's Formula One suit. With weight being crucial the materials allow for the lightest weight possible while still being flame and heat resistant.
programme.series-desc: Take a look at the details that go into Pierre Gasly's Formula One suit.

programme.title: Inside the Fourth Phase
programme.desc: Travis Rice and the Brain Farm crew talk about the 20-year-old poem that set off their journey to make The Fourth Phase. Their goals are clear, but accomplishing them will test everyone involved.
programme.series-desc: Travis Rice and the Fourth Phase crew talk about the poetic spark that set the whole epic project in motion.

programme.title: Inside the Fourth Phase
programme.desc: The film-makers talk about the huge pressure they face to once again raise the bar of snowboard films. It's an undertaking that will take cutting edge technology, planning and guts.
programme.series-desc: The film-makers discuss the immense pressure to raise the bar on snowboard films while telling a good story.

programme.sub-title: The best dirt bike riders push to new heights
programme.desc: Watch some of the best dirt bike riders, including Jeffrey Herlings, Jorge Prado, Marvin Musquin and Cody Webb, push themselves to be fitter, stronger and faster in pursuit of the top step of the podium.
programme.series-desc: The best dirt bike riders from supercross, motocross, desert, FMX and endurocross push themselves to the top.
